column5: Well, it was a small but quality group that got together tonight at the Judge & Jester in Grimsby.  Lots of good conversation and a lot of laughs.  I was sure that I had met John before, asked him if he knew Buoy Benson.  "That was me on the old board!!"  Okay,  okay, so I had talked to him at a couple of Swills in Oakville!    That was a long time ago!  He seemed just as nice as Buoy Benson     It was also a real pleasure meeting your much better half John.  You've got the green light, now get out there and buy that boat!! It was great to see Joe Fish and son Alex.  Funny, last time I saw him was the night I sold my last boat Hawg2.  Tonight I meet him again after just selling Hawg3.  See you in four or five years Joe! It was great to finally have a good chinwag with Tracker (Don).  Sonny is a class act and was great meeting him tonight.  Also found out he was Jen's brother!!  Sorry we didn't get much chance to talk Jen.  And last but not least good ole Loonietoon.  Nice seeing you again Kelvin.  Geez haven't seen you since............last Saturday. If anybody's ears were ringing its probably because we were talking about you.  Took this picture of Tracker so everybody would know what he looked like!   Jen, Loonietoon, Sonny, moi, Joe Fish, John's wife (dang I'm no good with names, sorry), Joe's son Alex, Tracker, John and Jen's friend (did I say I'm no good with names, sorry)   And reverse order....   We'll have to do it again in the fall!
Great group, Roger. Congrats on setting it up. Thanks for sharing those pics as well.  I feel blessed, my ears didn't ring last night.....
Great stuff Roger, looks like all had a good time, can't beat a night out with some OFC'rs.  Need to start thinking about another Barrie one soon, i'm getting thirsty  Maureen
Great group....had a blast! Wings HIGHLY recommended..  John..
Sorry I couldn't make it Roger, working some crazy long hours at work this week!
Looks like a good time.  Sorry we missed it.  Too far away  Joey

I am going to second that on the whole WINGS WERE GREAT THING!  It was wonderful to meet everyone last night.  The conversation could have gone on the entire evening.  What an amazing group of people.  Cheers,  Jen
Hey everyone!  Good on you to get out to a swill.  They are a lot of fun.  Not the easiest thing to organize, but the pics and report looks like it was all worth while.  Great job everyone!
Wings -- Beer -- Fishing Stories = Success!  Good job organizing Roger! I think it's going to be time soon for an Oakville Swill at the Firehall! mmm wings!  Tony
Dang...now I know why I had the migraine..  Great stuff Roger!
looks like a good time was had   - sorry i couldnt attend

once again, sorry i missed it, but will go to the next for sure! i found myself fishing port dalhousie all by my lonesome, just trying to ease my mind from all the things that are troubling me.. it worked...  pigeontroller, were u down at port D last night?? do u have a twin??

I had a great time! But Roger - think there might be something wrong with your camera - really makes my hair look grey! Was nice to get to meet Joefish and his son, sonny, loonietoon, John and his wife, and to see Jen again - she has a million dollar smile!  And Roger - well what can I say - never dull when he's around! Thanks for organizing such a great night for all of us.  And I agree - chicken wings were great - havta say - they beat the firehall!  Took a few pictures - but I played with the camera and screwed up my settings, so they aren't that good:   Joefish and son    John and his wife ( sorry John - next time say cheese! )     And the 3 stooges ( had the rest of us in tears ) Loonietoon, Sonny, And the man himself - Roger    And last but not least - Jen   Thanks again all - I had a great time and can't wait for the next one!!!  Don
Well, it was truly my pleasure to meet a bunch of great people with the same interests!!!,,,Already looking forward to the next meeting,,,whether it be on the water or over some good eats!!!!
